itemListElement.name: Vegan Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread with Cranberries

@graph.name: Vegan Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread with Cranberries

video.name: VEGAN GLUTEN FREE PUMPKIN BREAD | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan and Gluten-Free Pumpkin Bread with Cranberries
Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here— https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-gluten-free-pumpkin-bread-with-cranberries/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Vegan, Gluten-free Pumpkin Bread Recipe with cranberries and walnuts. This gum-free, Soy-free, Yeast-free bread can be made oat-free.

The pumpkin and banana hold the structure together and make this a very moist loaf and make this more of a Banana Pumpkin Bread. This bread also doesn’t need added gum. You can use a 1/2 tsp xanthan with the dry ingredients to help the crumb if you want. Use chocolate chips or dried fruit of choice for variation.

This loaf uses brown rice flour, almond flour, starch and oat flour. You can use any other flour which is similar to oat flour to sub oat flour if needed. I have not tried the loaf with any other starch. Arrowroot hasn’t worked well for me in the past. A blend of tapioca and corn might work, but I would recommend sticking to potato starch for the first try. Make this festive loaf with cranberries and walnuts/pecans and let me know how it turns out!

recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup oat flour (certified Gluten-free or other gf flour of choice like white sorghum, amaranth etc , do not use bean flour)
1/4 cup powdered sugar ((Blend up any unrefined sugar in a blender to make it fine))
1/2 tsp chai spice  (or use more pumpkin pie spice)
1 tbsp pysllium husk powder  (or chia seed meal)
3/4 cup + 2 tbsp pumpkin puree (not pumpkin pie filling)
1/4 cup or more fresh or frozen cranberries

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc. In a bowl whisk all the dry ingredients very well until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc. In a bowl whisk all the dry ingredients very well until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, mash the banana really well until smooth and there are no lumps. Add the rest of the wet ingredients and mix well to dissolve the sugar. Powder the pysllium husk before adding.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, mash the banana really well until smooth and there are no lumps. Add the rest of the wet ingredients and mix well to dissolve the sugar. Powder the pysllium husk before adding.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dry into the wet and mix until well combined and there are no wet streaks. Mix really well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the dry into the wet and mix until well combined and there are no wet streaks. Mix really well.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the cranberries and walnuts.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the cranberries and walnuts.

recipeInstructions.text: Drop into parchment lined pan. Even it out. top with pepitas
recipeInstructions.name: Drop into parchment lined pan. Even it out. top with pepitas

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at pre-heated 365 degrees F  / 180ºc for 55 to 65 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out almost clean with no liquid stuck to it. the bake time will depend on the consistency of the pumpkin puree and banana.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at pre-heated 365 degrees F  / 180ºc for 55 to 65 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out almost clean with no liquid stuck to it. the bake time will depend on the consistency of the pumpkin puree and banana.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool completely before slicing with a serrated knife. Preferably chill in the refrigerator for an hour or so before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool completely before slicing with a serrated knife. Preferably chill in the refrigerator for an hour or so before slicing.
